ai.summary: A challenging 18.2 km circular hike around Felbrigg Park in the UK, weaving through parkland and woodlands with uneven surfaces. Suitable for experienced hikers seeking a strenuous day out.
ai.terrain_summary: Expect a mix of well-trodden paths, grassy tracks, muddy sections, and some gentle ascents and descents. The route can be uneven with tree roots, wet ground after rain, and occasional gates and stiles. Waterproof footwear and good ankle support are advised.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for a hard 18.2 km route: bring sufficient water and snacks, check weather, wear sturdy boots, and carry a map or GPS. Let someone know your plans, respect local wildlife, and watch for muddy sections and low branches. In winter or after rain, trails can be slippery. Stay on marked paths in protected park areas.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good grip
Map, compass, or downloaded offline maps / GPS
Whistle and basic first aid kit
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March–October) for milder weather and longer daylight; mornings and late afternoons in shoulder seasons can be ideal.

seo.title: Felbrigg Park Circular – 18.2 km Hard Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Tackle the 18.2 km Felbrigg Park Circular in the UK. A hard, scenic loop through parkland and woodland with challenging terrain and elevation.
seo.h1: Felbrigg Park Circular – 18.2 km Hard Hike
